item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok says it is restoring service for U.S. users (143 points | 309 comments)
2. Using your Apple device as an access card in unsupported systems (56 points | 9 comments)
3. The surprising struggle to get a Unix Epoch time from a UTC string in C or C++ (28 points | 8 comments)
4. Robotics and ROS 2 Essentials (39 points | 13 comments)
5. Why Twitter is such a big deal (2009) (18 points | 14 comments)
6. The Fuzzing Book (74 points | 3 comments)
7. Making glow-in-the-dark Strontium Aluminate (60 points | 23 comments)
8. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (279 points | 209 comments)
9. Build a Database in 3000 Lines with 0 Dependencies (183 points | 12 comments)
10. GauntletAI (YC S17) will fly you out, train you to build w AI, give you 200k job ( | hide)
11. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (180 points | 119 comments)
12. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (110 points | 38 comments)
13. Build a tiny CA for your homelab with a Raspberry Pi (12 points | 2 comments)
14. “The Traitors”, a reality TV show, offers a useful economics lesson (92 points | 79 comments)
15. Strontium isoscape of sub-Saharan Africa allows tracing slave trade (2024) (12 points | 2 comments)
16. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (239 points | 143 comments)
17. Calculator Forensics (2002) (12 points | discuss)
18. VS Code Pets (470 points | 122 comments)
19. About A comprehensive guide for Linux Network (Socket) programming (40 points | 6 comments)
20. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (199 points | 36 comments)
21. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (84 points | 26 comments)
22. IsMyXFeedFucked – Analyze How Your X Feed's Impacting You (42 points | 72 comments)
23. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (489 points | 188 comments)
24. The "35-cent" Commodore 64 softmodem (97 points | 11 comments)
25. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (136 points | 62 comments)
26. We need to protect the protocol that runs Bluesky (125 points | 177 comments)
27. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (121 points | 80 comments)
28. Lenovo has removed the TrackPoint nub from new ThinkPad laptops (72 points | 98 comments)
29. Australian Open resorts to animated caricatures to bypass broadcast restrictions (213 points | 104 comments)
30. A System for the Sixties-and-a-Half: The Toshiba Visicom COM-100 (21 points | 3 comments)
